Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani launched Quintana’s second pitch of the game over the right-field fence for his second homer in as many days.
Mark Vientos’ rocket against Yoshinobu Yamamoto in the bottom of the inning tied it 1-1.
Mookie Betts’ ensuing single further applied pressure to Quintana.
Chris Taylor singled and Ohtani walked to begin another Dodgers rally in the fourth.
Betts homered against Phil Maton in the sixth to bury the Mets in a 7-2 hole.
Will Smith’s RBI single in the eighth sealed the Mets’ 10-2 loss.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were down 3-1 in the series and needed to win three straight games to continue their playoff run.
Pete Alonso expressed confidence in the team’s resiliency.
Manager Carlos Mendoza acknowledged the challenge posed by the Dodgers’ deep lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: Nimmo acknowledged the gravity of the situation, stating 'You lose one more game, you're done.'
